unnormalised: Entertainment News: Music Streaming Wars Heat Up!
normalised: Entertainment News: Music Streaming Wars Heat Up!

unnormalised: Mumbai, August 15th: The battle for your ears is getting intense! Forget *Border*, the real standoff is happening in the music streaming apps. Gaana is singing a different tune after facing tough competition, while Spotify seems determined to woo every aunty from Andheri to Alibaug with their personalized playlists.
normalised: Mumbai, August fifteenth: The battle for your ears is getting intense! Forget asterisk Border asterisk, the real standoff is happening in the music streaming apps. Gaana is singing a different tune after facing tough competition, while Spotify seems determined to woo every aunty from Andheri to Alibaug with their personalized playlists.

unnormalised: Rumor has it that IIT Bombay's music club is holding crisis meetings to decide which platform offers the best ROI (Return on Investment, for you non-engineers) on their data plans. Apparently, unlimited streaming chews through more data than a Karan Johar movie chews through melodrama.

unnormalised: One user complained, "I'm spending more time choosing a playlist than I do deciding what to order from Zomato!" Experts predict that soon, platforms will start offering "Desi Dad Approved" genre filters. Stay tuned, folks, it's going to be a *Dhoom* of musical proportions! Or maybe just a quiet bhajan. We'll see.
